block.p: Let me get this straight. According to John Tierney (''Justice Miers? Get Real,'' column, Oct. 8), Harriet E. Miers is a ''micromanager,'' ''fussing about punctuation,'' among other things.
As I recall, John G. Roberts Jr., recently confirmed as chief justice, was praised for his thorough attention to detail, exhibited by his editing and correcting of memorandums, among other things.
Let me get this straight. According to John Tierney (''Justice Miers? Get Real,'' column, Oct. 8), Harriet E. Miers is a ''micromanager,'' ''fussing about punctuation,'' among other things.
As I recall, John G. Roberts Jr., recently confirmed as chief justice, was praised for his thorough attention to detail, exhibited by his editing and correcting of memorandums, among other things.

Regardless of Ms. Miers's qualifications for the Supreme Court, or lack thereof, her alleged tendency to review punctuation is an asset, not a liability, and a fast-fading skill. In law, as in literature, a misplaced comma may change everything.
